attributes.action: Ofcom to Veto banding changes proposed by Royal Mail for Packet Post
attributes.additional_details:
Proposed banding changes by Royal Mail of packet post that come into force on 2nd April 2012 are potentially increasing small businesses daily spend on mail by 30% due to the additional charge of VAT also being added.

An item which weighs 50g that qualifies as a packet will cost the same as an item that weighs 700g.  Eliminating bands parcels up to 250g,  251g to 500g and 501g to 750g.  Replacing with a band of 0g to 750g.

Small retail businesses will have to completely restructure pricing to take into account increases in mail bill which may lead to a decrease in spend and prevent any growth and spend in the economy.

I call on the Government to call on Ofcom to VETO the proposals by Royal Mail to protect small businesses and potentially individuals who use the postal service.
